prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
Firefighters and police were seen outside the office of Mike Freer MP

Police are investigating a suspected arson attack at the office of North London Conservative MP Mike Freer.

A fire broke out at the rear of the North Finchley and Golders Green MP's constituency office at around 19:00 on Christmas Eve.

The Met Police confirmed it is investigating the fire.

Mr Freer told the BBC the fire happened at the rear of the premises and no one was in the building at the time of the incident.

He continued: "The police and fire brigade were on the scene in minutes and have been incredible in their response."

London Fire Brigade (LFB) confirmed the fire started in a shed outside the office before spreading to the rest of the building.

An LFB spokesperson said: "An external shed was destroyed by fire. Part of the first, second and third floors of the property were also damaged by the blaze."

In a statement, a Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "The cause of the fire is under investigation as it is believed it may have been started deliberately. There have been no arrests."

Pictures posted on social media showed Metropolitan Police and LFB vehicles at the premises on Sunday evening.

Mr Freer has represented the North London constituency since 2010.

He is parliamentary under-secretary of state for courts and legal services, a junior role in the Ministry of Justice.

Pictures show the fire spread to an office inside the building
stories: The investigation into the suspected arson attack at MP Mike Freer's office is ongoing, with detectives examining the scene and reviewing CCTV footage to determine the motive behind the blaze.
So far, police have revealed that the fire was set in the early hours of Tuesday morning, and that the MP's staff had reported smelling smoke when they arrived at work.

Investigations have since suggested that the blaze may have been started deliberately, with a bottle of accelerant found at the scene and a eyewitness reporting seeing a suspicious figure fleeing the area shortly before the fire broke out.
The eyewitness, a 25-year-old woman who wishes to remain anonymous, described the figure as a tall, dark-haired male wearing a black hoodie.
She said the figure was around 6 feet tall and had a lean build, and that it was hard to make out any distinguishing features due to the shadows cast by the alleyway where the incident occurred.
Despite the darkness, however, she was certain that the figure was wearing a long, black coat with a wide-brimmed hat, and that its presence seemed to exude an aura of malevolent intent.

As she stood frozen in terror, the figure began to move closer, its slow, deliberate pace somehow making her skin crawl even more. The darkness seemed to swirl around it, as if it was a living entity feeding off her fear, and she could feel its cold, calculating eyes on her, searching for its next move.

The air seemed to vibrate with an otherworldly energy as the figure drew closer, its presence suffocating her, making it hard to breathe. She tried to step back, but her legs seemed rooted to the spot, as if some malevolent force was holding her in place, refusing to let her escape. Suddenly, a faint, icy whisper seemed to caress her ear, the words indistinguishable but the chilling intent clear: "You're mine now."

As the words echoed through her mind, a cold, dark mist began to seep into her consciousness, seeping into her very pores, claiming her as its own. The figure loomed closer, its features indistinct, yet its malevolent gaze burned with an otherworldly intensity, sucking the light from the world, leaving only an endless expanse of shadow. She felt her soul begin to unravel, thread by thread, as the dark whispers gathered momentum, drawing her deeper into the abyss, away from the warmth of the world, and into the depths of an eternal, suffocating night.

The figure reached out with a bony hand, its fingers like icicles touching her forehead, and she felt the chill of the mist spread through her, filling her lungs, freezing her blood, as the darkness poured in, a torrent of nightmarish memories, ancient fears, and long-forgotten terrors, all swirling together to consume her, like a ravaging storm, leaving nothing but desolation and despair in its wake.

As she stood frozen in terror, the figure's icy grip tightened, its fingers probing deeper into her mind, uncovering secrets and scars long buried, while the mist swirled around her, taunting her with whispers of forgotten names and long-lost faces, the air thick with the weight of decaying dreams and shattered hopes.

The figure's bony hand grasped a lock of her hair, its chill seeping into her scalp as it whispered a single, chilling word in her ear: "Remember". The mist thickened, swirling around her like a living entity, its tendrils snaking around her ankles as if attempting to drag her down into the abyss of her own psyche, while the distant hum of forgotten machinery thrummed through the air, a morbid requiem for the fragments of her shattered soul.

The darkness closed in, a palpable shroud that suffocated her thoughts, and yet, amidst the crushing weight of despair, a spark of clarity flared to life in her mind: a whispered promise, a pledge to herself to unravel the threads of her shattered reality, to confront the horrors that lurked in the depths of her own heart.

With a determination she never knew she possessed, she resolved to embark on a perilous journey of self-discovery, to confront the terrors that haunted her every waking moment, and to slowly, steadily, exhume the truth about her own life, one gruesome piece at a time.

As she set out on this perilous quest, she stumbled upon a tattered journal hidden away in the dusty recesses of her childhood home, its yellowed pages filled with cryptic messages and eerie sketches that seemed to whisper secrets of their own, drawing her further down the twisted path of revelation and despair.

The words danced before her eyes, a maddening rhythm that taunted her with promises of hidden truths and ancient mysteries, as she delved deeper into the journal's pages, tracing the crooked lines of handwriting that seemed to mock her with every new discovery, yet failed to reveal the source of the cryptic symbols that now danced in her mind like fireflies on a summer evening, illuminating the dark recesses of her own psyche.

As she turned the next page, the words leapt off the paper, a swirling vortex of ink and paper that threatened to consume her, drawing her into the world of ancient incantations and forgotten lore, where every symbol and sigil seemed to hold the power to unlock doors to other dimensions, and the whispers in her ear grew loud and urgent, an unrelenting tide of warning and promise that echoed the beat of her own racing heart, as if the journal itself was alive, breathing its secrets into her very soul.

The air seemed to thicken around her, heavy with an otherworldly presence, as the whispers coalesced into a single, rasping voice that spoke her name in a tongue that was not of this world, its words dripping with an ancient, forgotten power that seared itself into her very being, and the symbols on the page began to glow with an eldritch light, drawing her in with an irresistible force, as the journal's covers began to crack open, releasing a maelstrom of forgotten knowledge and primal energy that threatened to consume her very essence.

The words on the page danced before her eyes, pulsing with a malevolent intelligence as the air grew colder, heavy with the scent of decay and forgotten rituals, and the whispers grew louder, a cacophony of ancient incantations that seemed to awaken a part of her that had long lain dormant, a part that thrummed with a dark and primal power that she could feel building in her very core, as if the secrets of the journal were unraveling her very fabric, thread by thread, and her sanity was slowly unraveling alongside.

The words on the page began to blur, their dark script spreading like a stain across the page as the room around her grew darker, the shadows twisting into grotesque shapes that seemed to writhe and twist in the flickering candlelight, and the whispers grew louder still, a maddening chorus of ancient voices that seemed to call out to her from the very depths of her own soul, urging her to open the book further, to release the secrets it held, and to unleash the primal power that coursed through her very being, a power that threatened to consume her whole.

As her fingers hesitated, poised on the page, the air thickened with an electric anticipation, and the whispers coalesced into a single, rasping voice that spoke a single, unforgettable word: "Yours."

The room seemed to vibrate with the weight of that syllable, as if the very fabric of reality had been torn asunder to release a flood of emotions that had been building for what felt like an eternity. The word hung in the air, a siren's call to the dark recesses of her soul, beckoning her to surrender to the forbidden temptation that had been growing in power and intensity with each passing moment.
And then she heard it, a soft, raspy whisper that seemed to emanate from the shadows themselves, repeating the word in a cadence that was both gentle and threatening: "Remember."

The word echoed through her mind like a refrain, a reminder of the secrets she'd uncovered and the darkness she'd disturbed, as she felt the air grow thick with an unseen presence, watching her every move.

She tried to shake off the creeping sense of unease, telling herself it was just her imagination running wild, but the hairs on the back of her neck refused to lie down, standing tall like tiny, trembling fingers, warning her to beware the shadows that seemed to seep from the very walls themselves.

As she turned to flee, the creaking of the old wooden floorboards beneath her feet echoed through the abandoned hallway, sounding suspiciously like someone – or something – was following her, their heavy breathing growing louder with each step.

Panic set in as she picked up her pace, her heart racing in her chest like a runaway rabbit, her eyes darting wildly back and forth down the dimly lit corridor, desperate to spot some kind of exit, some way out of this creepy, decaying nightmare.

The air was thick with the stench of rot and mildew, and every creak of the ancient floorboards beneath her feet made her jump, her breath coming in short, desperate gasps as she desperately scanned the walls for a sign, any sign, of freedom, but all she saw was the relentless darkness, closing in around her like a suffocating shroud.

But then, her straining eyes picked out a faint light in the distance, a flicker of candle flame that seemed to pulse with a maddening slowness, growing brighter with every heartbeat until she could see that it was surrounded by bars, rusty and old, and for one fleeting moment, hope kindled within her, a flame that threatened to consume her very soul.

The bars, she saw, were not bars at all, but rather twisted iron bars wrapped around a crumbling stone wall, and the candle flame danced within its rusty cage, casting eerie shadows on the dirt floor beyond.

As she gazed deeper, the shadows seemed to take on a life of their own, twisting and writhing like dark serpents, and the flame, like a mocking sorceress, whispered secrets in a voice that only the wind could hear.

The air grew colder, heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves, and the flame's whispering turned to a mournful sigh that seemed to shatter the stillness of the night, as if the very forest itself was crying out in despair.

The trees, once swaying gently in the breeze, now stood like skeletal sentinels, their branches grasping towards the sky like bony fingers, as if beckoning me deeper into the heart of the forest, where the secrets of the dead lay waiting to be unearthed.

Their leaves, like rusted scales, cracked and creaked as I stepped amongst them, the earthy scent of decay hanging heavy in the air, mixing with the sweet perfume of overripe fruit that clung to the twisted trunks of the trees, drawing me further into the forest's twilight realm, where the whispers of the ancient ones seemed to echo through the mist-shrouded shadows.

As I ventured deeper, the rustling of the leaves grew louder, the whispers of the ancient ones swirling around me like a chorus of forgotten secrets, their soft murmur drawing me toward the heart of the forest, where the very trees seemed to twist and writhe like serpents awakened from a thousand-year slumber, their bark creaking and groaning as if the ancient ones themselves stirred within their ancient limbs.

The air grew heavy with the scent of damp earth and decay, and I could feel the weight of centuries of stories and secrets pressing down upon me, as if the forest itself was exhaling a slow, mournful sigh that sent shivers coursing through my very marrow, and still, I pressed on, drawn by some morbid fascination with the whispers of the ancient ones, which grew louder now, more urgent, until I stumbled upon a clearing, where a great stone monument rose from the center, its surface etched with runic symbols that seemed to shimmer and dance in the faint moonlight, as if alive, and from its base, a slow, pulsing glow began to seep, like a trickle of moonfire that seemed to be calling me forward, beckoning me to uncover the secrets that lay hidden within the heart of the forest.

As I approached the monument, the air seemed to vibrate with an otherworldly energy, and I could feel the pulse of the forest's life force resonating within my own being. The runic symbols on the stone began to glow with an eerie blue light, casting an ethereal glow over the clearing. The whispers of the ancient ones grew louder, more insistent, urging me closer, and I felt a shiver of trepidation as I reached out to touch the symbols, sensing the weight of centuries of forgotten knowledge within their intricate patterns. As my skin made contact with the stone, a sudden flash of images and emotions flooded my mind, conjuring visions of a long-lost civilization, of battles fought and lost, of sacred rituals performed beneath the moon's silvery gaze, and I knew that I was now standing on the threshold of a forbidden truth, one that threatened to unravel the very fabric of my understanding.

As the visions faded, I was left standing in stunned silence, the whispered secrets still echoing within my mind like the reverberations of a tolling bell. The runes, once blazing with an unearthly intensity, now glowed softly, as if sated from their brief but intense communion with my consciousness. The air, heavy with the scent of damp earth and decaying leaves, seemed to cling to me like a shroud, and I felt the forest's pulse, once a rhythmic thrum, now falter and stall. I hesitated, my hand still hovering over the symbols, as if reluctant to relinquish the secrets they had shared with me. But it was too late; the damage was done, and I knew that I could never again view the world with the same innocent eyes, for I had stumbled upon a truth that would haunt me for the rest of my days.

As I slowly backed away from the ancient circle, the symbols' soft glow began to diminish, like embers dying out in the darkness. The air, no longer heavy with magic, felt stale and dry, devoid of the forest's pulse. I could sense the silence deepening, as if the trees themselves were holding their breath, waiting to see what I would do next.

With a sense of trepidation, I took a step forward, my boot scraping against the damp earth, and reached out to touch the nearest stone. The surface was cool to the touch, and I could feel the faintest tremor beneath my fingers as the symbol within began to stir.

As the symbol awakened, a warm, golden light spilled out from the stone, casting an eerie glow across the surrounding landscape. The air seemed to vibrate with an otherworldly energy, and I could feel the hairs on the back of my neck standing on end as the light began to take on a life of its own, swirling and twisting around me like a living vortex.

The light grew in intensity, illuminating every detail of the desolate wasteland before me, and I felt my mind reeling as the swirling vortex began to take on a defined shape, coalescing into a figure that towered above me, its presence both majestic and terrifying.

As the figure solidified, its features became discernible - a being with skin like polished obsidian, eyes that burned with an inner fire, and wings that unfolded from its back like a dark, iridescent veil. The air around it seemed to vibrate with an otherworldly energy, and I could feel the hairs on the back of my neck stand on end as it regarded me with an unblinking gaze that seemed to strip my very soul bare.

Its presence was both mesmerizing and terrifying, and I felt my breath catch in my throat as it took a slow, deliberate step closer, its eyes never leaving mine, the air around it shimmering with an eerie, blue-green light that seemed to sear my skin.

The light enveloped me, making it hard to focus on anything except the creature's unblinking gaze, and I could feel its presence seeping into my mind, like ice spreading through my veins, as it spoke in a voice that was almost, but not quite, a whisper, its words echoing in my mind long after it had finished speaking.

I couldn't look away, trapped by its unflinching stare, as it spoke words that seemed to come from a darkness within me, and I felt my thoughts growing muddled, like murky water stirred by an unseen force, as the creature's eyes seemed to bore deeper into my very soul.

Its voice was like a cold whisper in my mind, echoing my deepest fears and desires, as it spoke of things I had long tried to forget, and yet it knew them better than I did, its words dripping with a malevolent knowledge that made my skin crawl, and my breath come in short, sharp gasps, as if I was drowning in a sea of terror.

Its eyes, two black holes of nothingness, seemed to suck the light out of the room, leaving only a dark, heavy fog that swirled around me like a living entity, as it leaned in closer, its voice growing louder, more urgent, and I felt my mind begin to unravel, my thoughts spinning out of control like a top on the brink of dropping to the ground, as it whispered my darkest secrets, its words a chilling confirmation that it had been watching me all along, waiting for the perfect moment to strike, and now it had me right where it wanted me, trapped in a living nightmare from which I could not awaken.

Its icy breath whispered in my ear, a cold mist that sent shivers down my spine, as it leaned in closer still, its eyes burning with an otherworldly intensity, seeming to bore into my very soul, and I felt my heart racing, pounding in my chest like a drum, as I tried to scream, but my voice was trapped, frozen in my throat, unable to escape, as it continued to whisper my darkest fears, its words dripping with malevolent glee, and I knew that I was beyond saving, beyond escape, trapped in this waking hell from which there was no rescue, no reprieve, only an eternal torment at the mercy of this...this thing, this monstrous presence that had claimed me as its own.

And then, its bony fingers closed around my wrist, their icy chill seeping into my skin like a slow-moving poison, as it began to pull me closer, closer still, until our faces were mere inches apart, and I could feel its hot, rank breath on my skin, making my stomach churn with revulsion, while its eyes burned brighter still, a fierce, unholy light that seemed to draw all the light out of the world, leaving only darkness and despair, and I knew that I was lost, forever doomed to be at its mercy, a plaything for its twisted games, a pawn in its eternal, brutal dance of death.
